title: Samsung Set to Release 'Infinite' VR Headset to Compete with Apple's Vision Pro in 2024
originSummary: Samsung is set to launch its own virtual reality (VR) headset, code-named 'Infinite', in 2024 as a competition to Apple's Vision Pro.
The 'Infinite' is being developed with Google and Qualcomm and is part of an extended reality (XR) line, including augmented reality and mixed reality technologies.
Samsung intends to manufacture an initial 30,000 units of the headset to assess market response before fully investing in the project.
commentSummary: Samsung is planning to launch a virtual reality (VR) headset, named 'Infinite', hoping to rival Apple's Vision Pro.
The VR device, a part of an extended reality (XR) line that encompasses augmented reality and mixed reality, is being developed with Google and Qualcomm.
Samsung plans an initial production of 30,000 units to evaluate market response before solidly committing to the project, aiming for a 2024 release alongside the Galaxy Z Flip 6.

title: Apple Vision Pro Developer Labs Set to Happen Globally in November and December
originSummary: The Javascript code provided is related to the enabling of cookies.
The text makes mention of an upcoming event known as the Apple Vision Pro Developer Lab.
This event is scheduled to occur globally in November and December, with a session slated to take place in Shanghai.
commentSummary: The provided text is a Javascript code that deals with enabling cookies.
It mentions an upcoming "Apple Vision Pro Developer Lab" event set to occur globally in November and December.
An instance of this event will take place in Shanghai.

title: Samsung's Potential AR Headset Unveiling in 2024 to Challenge Apple's Vision Pro
originSummary: Reports suggest Samsung is developing an Augmented Reality (AR) headset, known as 'Infinite (muhan)', to compete with Apple's Vision Pro.
The new Galaxy-branded headset, which is expected to be launched at Samsung's Unpacked event in 2024, will likely use the second-generation XR chipset.
Despite the anticipated reveal, Samsung reportedly plans a limited production run of 30,000 units, and the release date and pricing details remain unconfirmed.
commentSummary: Samsung is rumored to be unveiling an Augmented Reality (AR) headset, internally referred to as 'Infinite', at their Unpacked event in the second half of 2024, likely to compete with Apple's Vision Pro.
The device is forecasted to carry Samsung's 'Galaxy' branding and be powered by the second-generation XR chipset.
Samsung reportedly plans to limit the production of the headset to only 30,000 units. However, the official release date and price point are still unconfirmed.

title: Samsung Collaborates with Google and Qualcomm to Develop Mixed Reality Headset, Set to Launch in 2024
originSummary: Samsung is reportedly developing a mixed reality headset, codenamed "Infinite," aimed to compete with Apple's Vision Pro and is expected to launch in 2024.
The development of "Infinite" is a collaborative effort with Google and Qualcomm; the unveiling is anticipated at Samsung's upcoming summer Unpacked event.
This isn't Samsung's debut into the virtual reality sector as they previously launched the Gear VR in 2015.
commentSummary: Samsung is reportedly developing a mixed reality headset, set to release in 2024, as competition for Apple's Vision Pro.
The headset, internally named "Infinite", is being jointly developed with Google and Qualcomm and is likely to be introduced at Samsung's summer Unpacked event.
This wouldn't be Samsung's first venture into Virtual Reality (VR), as they already launched the Gear VR in 2015.

title: Apple Organizes November Events for Developers Including App Store Programs, Vision Pro Labs, and Tech Consultations
originSummary: Apple is inviting developers to several events in November, including App Store programs, Vision Pro labs, and technology consultations.
These initiatives aim to educate developers on app discovery, engagement, custom product pages, and subscription strategies, among other topics.

Developers also get the opportunity to test Vision Pro at labs globally and can opt for one-on-one sessions about app design and emerging technologies. The sessions will be available online and in-person across different time zones.
commentSummary: Apple is inviting developers to an array of activities in November involving App Store programs, Vision Pro labs, and technology consultations.

The initiatives include learning opportunities about app discovery, engagement, custom product pages, and subscription practices. Developers will also have a chance to try Vision Pro at worldwide testing labs.
Multiple time zones will host these sessions, which will be available both online and in-person. Developers can opt for one-on-one consultations on app design and new technologies.

title: Samsung, Google and Qualcomm Collaborate on Mixed Reality Headset to Rival Apple's Vision Pro in 2024
originSummary: Samsung and Google, in collaboration with Qualcomm, are developing a mixed reality headset named "Infinite," set for a limited release by the end of 2024.
Samsung will oversee manufacturing, Google will handle the operating system and software development, and Qualcomm will provide the chipset. The OLED microdisplay will be supplied by Samsung Display.

The new product aims to rival Apple's Vision Pro, due for release in the coming year. They plan to introduce the new headset at Galaxy Unpacked in late 2024, with initially only 30,000 units available.
commentSummary: Samsung and Google, in partnership with Qualcomm, are developing a mixed reality headset named "Infinite," slated for limited release by the end of 2024. Samsung is responsible for manufacturing and Qualcomm for the chipset supply.
Google will create the operating system and software for this device, intending to compete with Apple's expected Vision Pro.
The product launch will take place at Galaxy Unpacked in late 2024, with an initial manufacturing run limited to 30,000 units. The OLED microdisplay will be provided by Samsung Display.

title: Samsung Set to Unveil AR Headset in 2024, yet with Initial Supply Far Short of Apple's Vision Pro
originSummary: Samsung intends to launch its first AR (Augmented Reality) headset, codenamed 'Infinite(muhan),' during its second 'Unpacked' event in 2024. The product is thought to compete with Apple's Vision Pro.

The AR headset, likely to be included in the 'Galaxy' brand, will utilize Qualcomm’s second-generation XR chipset. However, the initial production run is anticipated to be low, with 30,000 units planned for the first batch.
The headset is referred to as a niche product and is expected to have a higher than average price point, quite different from the projected shipment volume of Apple's Vision Pro at 600,000 units.
commentSummary: Samsung is set to debut its first Augmented Reality (AR) headset, to compete with Apple's Vision Pro, during its 2024 'Unpacked' event, under the codename 'Infinite(muhan)' and likely carrying the 'Galaxy' brand.

The AR headset will be driven by Qualcomm’s second-generation XR chipset. However, the initial production will be limited to just 30,000 units, substantially lower than the projected 600,000 units for Apple's Vision Pro.
The Samsung AR headset is considered a niche product, implying a potentially higher price tag due to its targeted consumer base.

title: Apple Innovating Battery Technology for Enhanced Energy Density in Future Vision Pro Headsets
originSummary: Apple is reportedly developing a next-generation battery with a new cathode composition, believed to enhance energy density and charging rate. Potential implementation is seen post-2025.
The tech giant is looking into the use of silicon as a substitute for graphite in the battery's anode and the application of carbon nanotubes as conductive materials.

These advancements are viewed as paramount to improving the battery duration of devices like Apple's forthcoming Vision Pro headset, which currently offers around two hours of battery life due to strenuous performance requirements.
commentSummary: Apple is reportedly developing an advanced battery with a new cathode composition to increase energy density and charging speed, which could be featured in their products post-2025.
The company is examining the use of silicon in place of graphite in the anode and carbon nanotubes as conductive material, albeit it's uncertain which technologies will actually be commercialized.

These battery advancements are essential for improving the battery life of high-performance devices such as Apple's forthcoming Vision Pro headset, which currently provides only two hours of battery life.

title: Apple to Design Its Own Advanced Batteries for Future iPhones, Improving Performance
originSummary: Apple is reportedly intending to design its own batteries for future iPhone models, using novel materials and technology to enhance performance, as per an ET News report.
The future batteries could potentially utilize a mix of nickel, cobalt, manganese, and aluminum for the cathode materials, which would improve energy output, stability, and density.

Other components like carbon nanotubes and silicon might also be used to increase battery capacity and minimize charging times. However, this new battery technology isn't expected to debut till 2025 or after, possibly in iPhone 17 or 18.
commentSummary: According to a report by ET News, Apple intends to create its own batteries for future iPhones, which aims to enhance performance using latest technologies and materials.

The future batteries might incorporate cathode materials made up of nickel, cobalt, manganese, aluminum, carbon nanotubes, and silicon content. These components could potentially increase energy density, output, stability and battery capacity, and decrease charging times.
The debut of this new battery technology is expected in 2025 or later, probably in the iPhone 17 or 18 iterations.
